verses.verse: The burden<WH4853> which<WH834> Habakkuk<WH2265> the prophet<WH5030> did see.<WH2372>

O LORD,<WH3068> how long<WH5704> <WH575> shall I cry,<WH7768> and thou wilt not<WH3808> hear!<WH8085> even cry out<WH2199> unto<WH413> thee of violence,<WH2555> and thou wilt not<WH3808> save!<WH3467>

Why <WH4100> dost thou show<WH7200> me iniquity,<WH205> and cause me to behold<WH5027> grievance?<WH5999> for spoiling<WH7701> and violence<WH2555> are before<WH5048> me: and there are<WH1961> that raise up<WH5375> strife<WH7379> and contention.<WH4066>

Therefore <WH5921> <WH3651> the law<WH8451> is slacked,<WH6313> and judgment<WH4941> doth never<WH3808> <WH5331> go forth:<WH3318> for<WH3588> the wicked<WH7563> doth compass about<WH3803> <WH853> the righteous;<WH6662> therefore<WH5921> <WH3651> wrong<WH6127> judgment<WH4941> proceedeth.<WH3318>

Behold <WH7200> ye among the heathen,<WH1471> and regard,<WH5027> and wonder marvelously:<WH8539> <WH8539> for<WH3588> I will work<WH6466> a work<WH6467> in your days,<WH3117> which ye will not<WH3808> believe,<WH539> though<WH3588> it be told<WH5608> you.

For, <WH3588> lo,<WH2009> I raise up<WH6965> <WH853> the Chaldeans,<WH3778> that bitter<WH4751> and hasty<WH4116> nation,<WH1471> which shall march<WH1980> through the breadth<WH4800> of the land,<WH776> to possess<WH3423> the dwelling places<WH4908> that are not<WH3808> theirs.
They <WH1931> are terrible<WH366> and dreadful:<WH3372> their judgment<WH4941> and their dignity<WH7613> shall proceed<WH3318> of<WH4480> themselves.

Their horses<WH5483> also are swifter<WH7043> than the leopards,<WH4480> <WH5246> and are more fierce<WH2300> than the evening<WH6153> wolves:<WH4480> <WH2061> and their horsemen<WH6571> shall spread<WH6335> themselves, and their horsemen<WH6571> shall come<WH935> from far;<WH4480> <WH7350> they shall fly<WH5774> as the eagle<WH5404> that hasteth<WH2363> to eat.<WH398>
They shall come<WH935> all<WH3605> for violence:<WH2555> their faces<WH6440> shall sup up<WH4041> as the east wind,<WH6921> and they shall gather<WH622> the captivity<WH7628> as the sand.<WH2344>

And they<WH1931> shall scoff<WH7046> at the kings,<WH4428> and the princes<WH7336> shall be a scorn<WH4890> unto them: they<WH1931> shall deride<WH7832> every<WH3605> stronghold;<WH4013> for they shall heap<WH6651> dust,<WH6083> and take<WH3920> it.
Then <WH227> shall his mind<WH7307> change,<WH2498> and he shall pass over,<WH5674> and offend,<WH816> imputing this<WH2098> his power<WH3581> unto his god.<WH433>

Art thou<WH859> not<WH3808> from everlasting,<WH4480> <WH6924> O LORD<WH3068> my God,<WH430> mine Holy One?<WH6918> we shall not<WH3808> die.<WH4191> O LORD,<WH3068> thou hast ordained<WH7760> them for judgment;<WH4941> and, O mighty God,<WH6697> thou hast established<WH3245> them for correction.<WH3198>

Thou art of purer<WH2889> eyes<WH5869> than to behold<WH4480> <WH7200> evil,<WH7451> and canst<WH3201> not<WH3808> look<WH5027> on<WH413> iniquity:<WH5999> wherefore<WH4100> lookest<WH5027> thou upon them that deal treacherously,<WH898> and holdest thy tongue<WH2790> when the wicked<WH7563> devoureth<WH1104> the man that is more righteous<WH6662> than<WH4480> he?
And makest<WH6213> men<WH120> as the fishes<WH1709> of the sea,<WH3220> as the creeping things,<WH7431> that have no<WH3808> ruler<WH4910> over them?

They take up<WH5927> all<WH3605> of them with the angle,<WH2443> they catch<WH1641> them in their net,<WH2764> and gather<WH622> them in their drag:<WH4365> therefore<WH5921> <WH3651> they rejoice<WH8055> and are glad.<WH1523>

Therefore <WH5921> <WH3651> they sacrifice<WH2076> unto their net,<WH2764> and burn incense<WH6999> unto their drag;<WH4365> because<WH3588> by them<WH1992> their portion<WH2506> is fat,<WH8082> and their meat<WH3978> plenteous.<WH1277>
Shall they therefore<WH5921> <WH3651> empty<WH7324> their net,<WH2764> and not<WH3808> spare<WH2550> continually<WH8548> to slay<WH2026> the nations?<WH1471>
